title: Ollama releases Python and JavaScript Libraries
dot:
digraph OllamaLibraries{rankdir=LR;node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, color=lightblue, fontname="Arial"];subgraph cluster_getting_started{label="Getting Started";color=lightgrey;node[style=filled, color=white];Python->"pip install ollama"->"import ollama
response = ollama.chat(model='llama2', messages=[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'Why is the sky blue?'}])
print(response['message']['content'])";JavaScript->"npm install ollama"->"import ollama from 'ollama'
const response = await ollama.chat({model: 'llama2', messages: [{ role: 'user', content: 'Why is the sky blue?' }]})
console.log(response.message.content)";}subgraph cluster_use_cases{label="Use Cases";color=lightgrey;node[style=filled, color=white];Streaming[label="Streaming
for chunk in chat('mistral', messages=messages, stream=True):
  print(chunk['message']['content'], end='', flush=True)"];MultiModal[label="Multi-modal
with open('image.png', 'rb') as file:
  response = ollama.chat(model='llava', messages=[{'role': 'user', 'content': 'What is strange about this image?', 'images': [file.read()]}])
print(response['message']['content'])"];TextCompletion[label="Text Completion
result = ollama.generate(model='stable-code', prompt='// A c function to reverse a string
')
print(result['response'])"];CustomModels[label="Creating custom models
modelfile='''
FROM llama2
SYSTEM You are mario from super mario bros.
'''
ollama.create(model='example', modelfile=modelfile)"];CustomClient[label="Custom client
ollama = Client(host='my.ollama.host')"];}subgraph cluster_github{label="GitHub";color=lightgrey;node[style=filled, color=white];"New GitHub handle"[label="New GitHub handle
These libraries, and the main Ollama repository now live in a new GitHub organization: ollama"];"Community Contribution"[label="Community Contribution
Thank you to all contributors
Saul for ollama-js"];}"Ollama Python Library"->"Getting Started";"Ollama JavaScript Library"->"Getting Started";"Getting Started"->"Use Cases";"Use Cases"->"GitHub";"New GitHub handle"->"Community Contribution";}

title: Brains are not required to think or solve problems – simple cells can do it
dot:
digraph BasalCognition{rankdir=LR; Planaria[label="Planaria
- Flatworm
- Simple structure
- Perfect regeneration"];Levin[label="Michael Levin
- Biologist
- Studies cell intelligence
- Research on regeneration"];BasalCognition[label="Basal Cognition
- Intelligence outside the brain
- Collective intelligence of cells"];Memory[label="Memory in Cells
- Regular cells can store information
- Bioelectricity as memory medium"];Evolution[label="Evolution of Cognition
- Cognition predates brains
- Collaboration of cells leads to complex organisms"];Applications[label="Applications
- Cancer treatment
- Limb regeneration
- Understanding intelligence in AI"]; Planaria->Levin[label="Test subject for cognition"];Levin->BasalCognition;Levin->Memory;Levin->Evolution;BasalCognition->Memory;BasalCognition->Applications;SlimeMold[label="Slime Mold
- Problem-solving
- Learning through experience"];Plants[label="Plants
- Respond to stimuli
- Memory and decision-making"];Bees[label="Bees
- Social intelligence
- Communication"]; BasalCognition->SlimeMold;BasalCognition->Plants;BasalCognition->Bees;Conclusion[label="Conclusion
- Rethinking intelligence
- Cognition is fundamental to life"];Applications->Conclusion;}
